TITLE.P: Building of a New Aviation Fuel Facility

SHORT_DESCR.P: Building, according to European norms and standards, of a new fuel facility comprising a 15 000 m3 nominal capacity (Jet-A1 fuel storage tanks, with associated pipework to receive Jet-A1 from road bridger receipt and CEPS delivery methods) fuel farm and all associated infrastructures and facilities to be developed which will be located on the new sites within the Luxembourg Airport complex. The new fuel facility shall comprise all buildings, equipment, plants and facilities as further detailed in the tender documents.

The contracting entity wishes to appoint an experienced building contractor to build a new fuel facility according to European norms and standards at Luxembourg Airport within a period which shall not exceed 24 months.The new fuel facility shall comprise a 15 000 m3 nominal capacity (Jet-A1 fuel storage tanks, with associated pipework to receive Jet-A1 from road bridger receipt and CEPS delivery methods) fuel farm and all associated infrastructures and facilities to be developed which will be located on the new sites within the Luxembourg Airport complex and which will comprise inter alia connecting pipelines to the P10 cargo apron hydrant system, road bridger receipt area (for receipt of Jetfuel from landside), into-plane airside operations, loading, maintenance and test area, aviation fuel receipt facilities, aviation fuel storage tanks, aviation fuel delivery facilities (Jet-A1), fire-fighting facilities, associated testing, safety and environmental facilities, plus the structures, buildings, plant, outdoor facilities and equipment. The contracting entity wants the awarded contractor to fulfil the following objectives:
• to build a new fuel facility at the designated location within the Airport premises (landside and airside) including three (3) new tanks of 5 000 m3 nominal capacity each for Jet-A1;
• to construct/install the associated units required to operate the new fuel farm, Road Bridge and CEPS Pipeline Reception Areas, Into-plane Airside operations, loading, maintenance and test area;
• to complete and commission a new hydrant system at the cargo terminal apron (P10), supplied from the new fuel facility;
• to install all required pipelines for fuel receipt and delivery, buildings, structures, outdoor areas, infrastructures and connecting networks;

• for the avoidance of doubt, not to have any responsibilities with respect to the decommissioning and removal of the existing fuel farm once the new fuel facility is commissioned and operational. The new fuel facility shall be built according to European norms and standards.Further details of the new fuel facility are provided in the RFQ documentation made available to all Applicants. The RFP documentation provides a detailed description of the requirements and scope, but shall only be made available to qualified tenderers due to general airport security requirements.

CRITERIA_CANDIDATE.P: If there are more than six (6) applicants who have not been excluded from the tender process and who meet minimum requirements, the contracting entity shall identify a maximum of six (6) applicants which are likely to become tenderers for the RFP Phase in accordance with the ranking established based on the criteria set out in the RFQ, pursuant to the possibility offered by Article 139 of the Law of 8 April 2018 on public procurement. These criteria based on which the applicants will be ranked as specified in the RFQ are:
1) Financial and economic standing of the applicant: maximum 30 points: financial robustness of the applicant as further described in the RFQ;

• maximum 120 points as further described in the RFQ maximum 50 points: one construction project in the field of civil engineering, implemented within the last five (5) years in an industrial, airport, port or railway environment, for which applicants have assumed the construction and the commissioning, of a value of minimum EUR 20 000 000 (excl. VAT);

• maximum 50 points: one project implemented within the last ten (10) years in an airport environment, where applicants have constructed, including commissioning, storage tank(s) with associated pipework, for kerosene receipt and delivery, of a value of minimum EUR 4 000 000 (excl. VAT);

• maximum 20 points: for the purpose of the ranking, applicants have the opportunity to submit one additional project reference that they consider appropriate in terms of nature and complexity to the new fuel facility. This additional project shall have been implemented within the last ten (10) years.

SUITABILITY.P: Along with their application, the tenderer provides a signed ESPD (European Single Procurement Document) as statement on oath that they are not excluded from the tender. The application is further detailed in the RFQ document along with a checklist of documents to be submitted.

RULES_CRITERIA.P: • 1 construction project in the field of civil engineering, implemented within the last 5 years in an industrial, airport, port or railway environment, for which applicants have assumed the construction and the commissioning, of a value of minimum EUR 20 000 000 excl. VAT; and

• 1 project implemented within the last 10 years in an airport environment, where Applicants have constructed, including commissioning, storage tank(s) with associated pipework, for kerosene receipt and delivery, of a value of minimum EUR 4 000 000 excl. Implementation of quality management, environmental management and safety management systems.

Min annual turnover: EUR 30 000 000 Min net asset value: = or > EUR 20 000 000 Min Quick ratio: 0,9:1 or >. Bank guarantee on 1st demand. Obtaining min levels of insurance. For details of the min requirements, refer to the RFQ.

INFO_ADD.P: The minimum requirements for application are specified in the RFQ document. The RFQ documents for the submission of the applications shall be downloaded from the Luxembourgish public procurement portal by searching for the above mentioned tender on their official site(https://pmp.b2g.etat.lu/) in accordance with the Luxembourg law dated 8 April 2018 on public procurement. Submission of applications may only take place via upload to the Luxemburgish public procurement portal on their official site (https://pmp.b2g.etat.lu/) under requirement of Luxembourg law. It should be noted that in order to submit documents through the Luxemburgish public procurement portal (such as, but not limited to requests for information, applications and proposals) and, as the case may be, sign them electronically, tenderers must register via said portal either by using Luxtrust certificates (https://www.luxtrust.lu/en) or alternative means proposed on said portal (http://mpe-docs.local-trust.com/outils-v4/ATEXO-Sign.zip). For additional information please consult the following address: (https://marches.public.lu/fr/procedures/dematerialisation/authentification-signature.html). Any economic operator using the Portal is deemed to have read and accepted the provisions and conditions of the terms of use of the Portal as laid down by the Ministerial Decree of 18 January 2021. Tenderers acknowledge that the contracting entity has no other choice under Luxembourg Law than to disregard applications delivered by any other means than through the appropriate channels of the Luxemburgish public procurement portal and that the contracting entity cannot take actions on their behalf to further accommodate them in this regard.
